posts.post_content:
The most fun thing to do with Phage is imprint her on a [Summoner's Egg](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Summoner's Egg) or [Clone Shell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clone Shell). Give the card to your opponent somehow ([Bazaar Trader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bazaar Trader), [Legerdemain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Legerdemain) -- whatever). Then simply kill the Shell / Egg.
  
   
It's roughly as fun AND reliable as playing your state lottery.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Card of the Day - Wednesday, August 13, 2008
  
 Phage is an extremely powerful and complicated character. She began life as [Jeska, Warrior Adept](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jeska, Warrior Adept), but [Braids, Cabal Minion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Braids, Cabal Minion) gave her a new life as a walking engine of death. It is therefore somewhat odd that one of the cards she appears on is the relatively innocuous [Swat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swat). You don't really think of someone who can kill with a touch just hauling off and smacking an underling.
posts.html:
Card of the Day - Wednesday, August 13, 2008
Phage is an extremely powerful and complicated character. She began life as Jeska, Warrior Adept, but Braids, Cabal Minion gave her a new life as a walking engine of death. It is therefore somewhat odd that one of the cards she appears on is the relatively innocuous Swat. You don't really think of someone who can kill with a touch just hauling off and smacking an underling.

Posted By: Studoku (7/22/2011 7:57:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I have to say, she is by far and long, my favorite Magic card. I really think people don't give this card enough credit. While its true that she can, in many many ways, be the one that kills YOU and not your opponent, she EMBODIES Black Magic. She fits, whole and true, the 'kill or be killed' concept of Black. The 'win at ANY cost' that used to be so prominent in Black cards. She also instills a sort of nervouseness in players if they don't have that immediate answer, and must sacrifice all they have built to keep her away until they can be rid of her.
  
   
Functionally, the card is, as many have noted, very difficult to use. But its exactly why she is so much fun to play. Experienced players bash her with unrelenting malice, calling her a 'noob card'. Any card that can give you a potential auto win deserves such a major drawback. Its BLACK.
  
   
Phage has always had a great effect on games in my playgroup. We are not, by any means, pros. We play casual, and we often play EDH. And its so... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

@Lifegainwithbite

Torpor Orb would indeed counter the ability. Alternatively, Platinum Angel at the same CMC would work, and can be cheated out. Stifle is another option, but takes an extra blue mana on top of the cost for Phage herself.

You could always get lucky with 4 Dark Rituals on turn 1, if you know it's safe from removal.
